heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.9°C) and outside temperature (up 3.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%) and rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 600 m) and light levels (up 2705 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1004 m) and light levels (up 6458 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 599.5m lower than yesterday, 863.2m lower than the past week, 1003.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 760m minimum and 2130m maximum, with an average of 731.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1595.1m and 1735.8m.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 5.2°C higher than yesterday, 6.3°C higher than the past week, 34.6°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the dew point temperatures ranged from a minimum of 2.6°C to a maximum of 14.1°C, averaging 14.9°C; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 8.6°C and 49.5°C respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, very clammy and humid and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, fog or low cloud is expected, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
